dt: {bc}to behave in an arrogant or intimidating way {bc}to play the bully {bc}{sx|swagger||}
{bc}to intimidate or harass by bluster or personal pressure

dt.t: football players being {wi}hectored{/wi} by their coach

pt: {sc}bait{/sc} {sc}badger{/sc} {sc}heckle{/sc} {sc}hector{/sc} {sc}chivy{/sc} {sc}hound{/sc} mean to harass by efforts to break down. {sc}bait{/sc} implies wanton cruelty or delight in persecuting a helpless victim.
{sc}badger{/sc} implies pestering so as to drive a person to confusion or frenzy.
{sc}heckle{/sc} implies persistent annoying or belligerent interruptions of a speaker.
{sc}hector{/sc} carries an implication of bullying and domineering.
{sc}chivy{/sc} suggests persecution by teasing or nagging.

shortdef: to behave in an arrogant or intimidating way : to play the bully : swagger
to intimidate or harass by bluster or personal pressure
